solution_line_template: Mr. Montero is traveling a total distance of {one_way_distance} miles + {one_way_distance} miles = <<{one_way_distance}+{one_way_distance}={total_distance}>>{total_distance} miles.
There are {total_distance} miles / {miles_per_set} miles = <<{total_distance}/{miles_per_set}={sets_needed}>>{sets_needed} sets of 400 miles in {total_distance} miles.
So Mr. Montero needs {gallons_per_set} gallons/set x {sets_needed} sets = <<{gallons_per_set}*{sets_needed}={total_gallons_needed}>>{total_gallons_needed} gallons in all.

Since his car has {current_gallons} gallons already, then he needs to add {total_gallons_needed} gallons - {current_gallons} gallons = <<{total_gallons_needed}-{current_gallons}={gallons_to_add}>>{gallons_to_add} gallons more.
